group_1.textLeft: Look! Nothin's happening!

group_1.textRight: Not at the moment, but I'm still going@with you to the studio.

group_1.textLeft: Geeze! I'm in junior high, y'know?!
Don't treat me like a kid!

group_1.textRight: You know that Yukuni is a dangerous place@for Magical Girls.
I'm not treating you like a kid.

group_1.textLeft: Yes, you are!
Even today, when I met up with you,@you checked to see if I forgot anything.

group_1.textRight: You often forget things.

group_1.textLeft: Urgh… But I'm gettin' better at that,@little by little.
Like today, I put my house key in my wallet@so I wouldn't lose it…
[chara:103601:effect_emotion_surprise_0][se:7226_shock]…Ack! Where's my wallet?!

group_1.textRight: Huh?

group_1.textCenter: What do I do, what do I do?!@I gotta find it!
I'll call my manager and ask him to come help!
Or, no, should we go to the police station first?!
If I don't find it…@What am I gonna tell my mom?!

group_1.textLeft: [chara:103601:effect_emotion_surprise_0][se:7226_shock]Ah?!

group_1.textRight: I went back the way we came and found@where you dropped it.

group_1.textLeft: Thanks, Rabi!@You're a real lifesaver…

group_1.textRight: Perhaps it fell out...
when you took your phone out of your bag@earlier.
Coming with you was the right decision@after all.

group_1.textLeft: Ugh… Can't argue with that…

group_1.textRight: Okay, I'll wait for you nearby.

group_1.textLeft: Gotcha. I'm off!
Urara!
You should call me once in a while.@I've been worried, ya know?

group_1.textRight: Sorry 'bout that…

group_1.textLeft: Aw, it's fine. You came all this way.
So… You're really quittin'?

group_1.textRight: Uh-huh…

group_1.textLeft: Well… That's a shame.
We've been marketin' you and Kurara,@you know.
As a street performer pair.
Your duo's recent talk show and MC work@has been well-received,
and your talent show was going well too…

group_1.textRight: Look, I appreciate you sayin' that, but...
I've made up my mind already.

group_1.textLeft: …You've got what it takes.
You could make it big as a street performer.
It's a shame you're callin' it quits just because@you fell out with Kurara…
Besides, Kurara's pretty ticked right now,
but once she cools down,
she might say she wants to bring the duo@back together.

group_1.textRight: …Has she been doin' okay?

group_1.textLeft: Yeah, she's fine.@You haven't heard from her?

group_1.textRight: Nope… She hasn't said a word to me since@we split up…

group_1.textLeft: Even though the bus accident wasn't@your fault…

group_1.narration: A while ago, when the existence@of Magical Girls went public in Yukuni City,@a big commotion broke out.

The conflict between those who wanted to protect@Magical Girls and those who wanted to get@rid of them eventually came to a reconciliation.@But then a bus carrying the protectors fell@down a mountain, killin' a bunch of people…
That incident led to me@becomin' a Magical Girl.
But then…because of me,@my old partner Kurara became the leader@of the eradication faction…
…It was a terrible breakup,@and I don't think we'll ever be@a duo again, but I still loved her.
I wanted to at least clear up@the misunderstandin' and@make up with her, but…

group_1.textRight: …Whatever the truth is, I can't stay here@anymore.
I'm not gonna change my mind about retiring.

group_1.textLeft: …I understand what you're thinking, Urara.
Just… One last thing.@Would ya take a job for me?

group_1.textRight: What is it?

group_1.textLeft: I want ya to spend a day...
Coaching a children's diabolo class.

group_1.textRight: Me…?

group_1.textLeft: A celebrity who's both popular with kids,@and can teach the diabolo!
Puttin' it that way, it'd have to be either you@and Kurara, right?

group_1.textRight: What about Kurara…?

group_1.textLeft: This is an urgent job.
She's busy with other work, so we're sorta@in a bind.
I've already gotten permission from@your parents.
It's up to you whether you wanna accept@the job or not… How about it?

group_1.textRight: …If that's the case, sure.
If you're in trouble and I can help,@then I'm on it!

group_1.textLeft: That's great!
But I apologize in advance.
It's short-notice, and we ain't got a lot of staff@on-hand…

group_1.textRight: I can do it by myself.@Just leave it to me!
